stories.text:
Hi HN!

My day job is a Ruby on Rails position. I'm considering looking for new positions, and wonder if learning Python would be worth it for coding interviews. I'm open to another Rails position, but it's not my preferences so I'm not sure about using Ruby for interviews since Python seems to be a lot more common for those types of questions. I also know TS/JS, but have heard that there can be a stigma when using JS for non webdev roles. Any advice?

Thanks!
stories.title: Ask HN: Learning Python for job interviews if I already know Ruby?

stories.text:
I'm currently reading and studying formal languages using books, mainly 'Introduction to Automata Theory, Languages and Computation' by Hopcroft and Ullman. But I also been enjoying reading articles from Tomasseti[0] and would like to know if there are some other sites/blogs that focus on topics like programming languages, parsing, natural language processing, regular expressions, grammar, text processing, text encoding, Unicode and even non-computer linguistics.

I guess I wouldn't mind some book recommendations as well

[0] https://tomassetti.me/
stories.title: Ask HN: What are some good blogs/sites about formal/computer languages?
